He was the oldest member of Congress at his death at age 92, President pro tempore of the US Senate, and was the longest-serving Senator in history, having been first elected in 1958. Byrd twice held the position of Senate Democrat Leader, was a crucial 60th vote in holding a filibuster-proof Senate in 2009, is the only senator to have cast over 18,000 votes,[1] never once lost a general election[2] and remained a Democrat Party legend and icon until the end. He was third in line to the Presidency behind Vice President Joe Biden and Speaker Nancy Pelosi. permalink parent award report block reply view 3 more comments... When that happened, my nephew who was homeschooled by my based sister, was at his first year of college.   He started texting his mother about how she could and his dad could be so evil as to support a nazi for president.   My sister isn't online and doesn't really keep up with politics that much and she started texting me frantically asking me what this was about.    I was able to get the vid from here P.W. and send it to her showing Elon did the "my heart goes out to you" action.    Then I texted her oodles of pics, also which were on this forums, showing dems doing the Nazi salute that is roman salute or appearing to do it.
